security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files with TypeScript code examples. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access patterns, and no suspicious behavior detected. All content is educational reference material for Payload CMS development.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS applications with expert guidance
content.value_statement: Payload CMS development requires understanding collections, fields, hooks, and access control patterns. This skill provides instant access to reference documentation and code examples for common tasks.
actual_capabilities: Generates collection and field configurations with proper TypeScript types
Explains access control patterns including RBAC and multi-tenant setups
Provides hook patterns for beforeChange, afterChange, and lifecycle events
Shows query patterns for Local API, REST, and GraphQL
Guides plugin development with package structure and patterns
Demonstrates transaction handling and database adapter usage
limitations: Cannot execute Payload CMS code or connect to databases
Does not provide real-time debugging of running applications
Cannot generate custom UI components or admin panel layouts
Limited to Payload CMS version 3.x patterns and syntax

output_examples.input: How do I create a relationship field that filters options?
output: Use filterOptions on the relationship field to restrict selectable documents
You can filter by any field value like status or category
The filter runs dynamically when the dropdown opens

best_practices: Always pass req to nested operations in hooks to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess: false when using the Local API with a user parameter
Use context flags to prevent infinite loops when hooks trigger updates
anti_patterns: Never assume Local API respects access control by default
Avoid creating nested operations without passing the req parameter
Do not use synchronous field hooks for expensive async operations

faq.question: Which databases does Payload support?
faq.answer: Payload supports MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and SQLite through official database adapters. Each adapter has specific features like transaction support.

faq.question: Are there limits on collection or field count?
faq.answer: Payload has no hard limits on collections or fields. Performance depends on your database and query complexity.

faq.question: How do I integrate Payload with my existing Next.js app?
faq.answer: Payload 3.x installs directly in your Next.js app folder. Add payload.config.ts and use getPayload() in server components.

faq.question: Does this skill access my project files or database?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides documentation and code examples. It cannot execute code or access your local environment.

faq.question: What if my hook causes an infinite loop?
faq.answer: Use req.context flags to track operation state. Check if (context.skipHooks) before triggering nested updates.

faq.question: How is this different from the official Payload docs?
faq.answer: This skill provides curated patterns and quick reference tables. Official docs at payloadcms.com offer comprehensive tutorials.
